purpose: The email announces a postdoctoral opportunity at the University of Otago, focusing on a project related to AI and software reliability. The project, titled 'Automating software violation detection and repair: future-proofing software reputation and skills development,' aims to develop algorithms for software violation detection and repair, support New Zealand software developers, and address the tech skills shortage. The email invites candidates with a background in software engineering or AI to apply and encourages sharing the opportunity with others who may be interested.

evidence_sentences: Join us at the University of Otago as a Postdoctoral Fellow on our $1 million project: 'Automating software violation detection and repair: future-proofing software reputation and skills development.'
Our project aims to: Develop cutting-edge, AI-inspired algorithms for software violation detection and repair.
Support New Zealand software developers in delivering reliable, secure, high-value software.
If you have a background in software engineering, AI, or related fields and want to contribute to future-proofing software development, we want to hear from you!
